comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

Setting up a email account for a cPanel domain,  Thunderbird uses common server names to setup the account with.

IMAP/POP/SMTP -- mail.domain.com

common server names sets it up with username without @domain.com

cPanel uses - username@domain.com

Maybe if common server names could include @domain.com

comments.text: How would we figure out that they are configured using cpanel ?

comments.raw_text:
In general for other domains with the common server names that Thunderbird uses in the auto-setup.

Would it be possible if common server names could be @domain.com - for general domains?
